thread.title: This Crab Species Named After the Magical World of Harry Potter Is the Best Tribute to Snape
thread.title_full: This Crab Species Named After the Magical World of Harry Potter Is the Best Tribute to Snape

author: Megan McCluskey
title: This Crab Species Named After the Magical World of Harry Potter Is the Best Tribute to Snape
text:
A newly discovered crab species a name that is sure to please Harry Potter fans, as it alludes to two beloved characters from J.K. Rowling’s magical series.
Dubbed Harryplax severus , the latest addition to the crab family was first collected by late researcher Harry Conley along the shores of Guam nearly 20 years ago, according to Live Science . However, it wasn’t until recently that biologists Peter Ng and Jose Christopher E. Mendoza identified it as a new species. 
While its genus, Harryplax , is a direct nod to both the researcher and the Harry Potter himself, severus has an even deeper wizarding world meaning. The moniker is “an allusion to a notorious and misunderstood character in the Harry Potter novels, Professor Severus Snape, for his ability to keep one of the most important secrets in the story, just like the present new species which has eluded discovery until now, nearly 20 years after it was first collected,” Ng and Mendoza wrote in their ZooKeys study .
Accio Crab! Newfound #Crab Honors #HarryPotter and Professor Snape https://t.co/3Rjln8A2oN pic.twitter.com/uoOLrFiAQ6 
— Live Science (@LiveScience) January 24, 2017
